info.author: Niels Serup
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Affero General Public License v3
info.description:
==========
iterconion
==========

**No release out yet!**

iterconion is an interactive conversation manager.

iterconion can be used both as a command line tool and as a Python
module. It requires Python 3.1+.

iterconion is part of the roptoligs project (but can be used
independently of other roptoligs modules). See the roptoligs wiki at
http://roptoligs.metanohi.org/ for details.


License
=======

iterconion is free software under the terms of the GNU Affero General
Public License version 3 (or any later version). This is version 0.1.0
of the program.


Installation
============

To install iterconion, run::

  python3 setup.py install

You must be a superuser to do this.


Use as command line tool
========================

When you have installed iterconion, run::

  iterconion --help

to see how to interact with iterconion via the command-line.


Use as Python module
====================

When iterconion has been installed, it can be used just like any other
Python module. To see which parts of the module are useful, and to see
how those parts function, run::

  pydoc3 iterconion

``iterconion`` can be imported with a simple ``import`` statement.


Development
===========

iterconion uses Git for code management. To get the latest branch,
clone it from gitorious.org like this::

  $ git clone git://gitorious.org/iterconion/iterconion.git


This document
=============
Copyright (C) 2011  Niels Serup

Copying and distribution of this file, with or without modification,
are permitted in any medium without royalty provided the copyright
notice and this notice are preserved.  This file is offered as-is,
without any warranty.
